author: remi13131
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

I developped a script that runs fine for my unprivileged user. 
Then I wanted to execute it from a PHP script, and I ran into the problem that no Cmdlets are available. Investigfating further, I found out that www-data user cannot run any Cmdlets. The Powershell itself can be loaded though. 

Steps to reproduce
------------------
Install Powershell for Ubuntu on an Ubuntu machine that has a www-data user created by apache. 
Then try this : 
```
some-user $ sudo su -s /bin/bash www-data 
www-data  $ /usr/bin/powershell
PowerShell 
Copyright (C) 2016 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

Cannot load PSReadline module.  Console is running without PSReadline.
PS > get-command
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
List of all availbale Cmdlets. 

Actual behavior
---------------
```
get-command : The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.AnalysisCache' threw an exception.
At line:1 char:1
+ get-command
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-Command], TypeInitializationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.TypeInitializationException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetCommandCommand
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

I am running Powershell for Ubuntu 16.04 on Ubuntu 16.10

```
PS > $PSVersionTable                                                                                                
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                    
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                    
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                                                                                                                              
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                                     
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                  
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                                                                                  
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.15                                                                                                                                          
CLRVersion                                                                                                                                                                              
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                      
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                      
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```
```
PS > Get-ExecutionPolicy                                                                                            
Unrestricted
```

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hum!!  I used to get the PSReadline error on the older PowerShell Alpha version.  Have you try up get PowerShell v6.0.0-alpha.17.  

The newer version has lots of fixes.  I'm not getting the PSReadline error now.

Give it a try and post the results.

:)

comments.author: remi13131
comments.body:
@MaximoTrinidad Thanks for this ! I indeed upgraded to PowerShell v6.0.0-alpha.17 and this did the trick ! So problem solved. 
Cheers

title: No Cmdlets available for www-data user on Ubuntu
